persona.name: Ethan
persona.activities: Ethan is a student just like many others: he has no particular problems or outstanding successes. Unlike many others, he believes that taking some shortcuts (of dubious legality) can be of some help. In order to gain some extra spending-money and fill his always-empty student pockets, he devotes part of his time to earning money illegally as a spammer. One of his activities, for example, is sending messages on behalf of individuals who sell counterfeit good, or participating in an email campaign for a "pump and dump" scheme.
persona.attitudes: Much like many other students, Ethan does not have a strong inclination toward rules and laws. In fact, he has a quite pronounced inclination toward illicit activities that can be more or less remunerative. However, he still doesn't want to get in trouble with the law, he is just willing to risk it because he wants money even more.
persona.aptitudes: Ethan has cultivated some of the essential skills for his fraudulent network activities. His habitual tasks consist in looking for vulnerable networks, exploiting such vulnerabilities and then gathering data from those non security-savvy systems. Whenever possible and whenever he thinks it is not too risky, he enjoys accessing and taking control of vulnerable systems and harvesting data from vulnerable targets. When successful, this often includes usernames, passwords, and also details of credit cards that have been illicitly gained by other malicious intruders. This information can be profitably used for trading of credit card number (good offers for them in Black Market) and for circumvent monitoring system and anti-spam filters.
persona.motivations: He wants easy money, since in his opinion it is very rarely the most tiresome way that is the best one. During his student career, he has found it difficult to make much money in legal ways. Since he already has a botnet at his service, why not use it for some additional source of wealth? Being a botnet administrator has many other benefits. For example, he can attack politicians with whom he disagrees. After all, Ethan has some sense of civic responsibility in his own way.
persona.skills: Ethan most important skills lies in the administrator-level knowledge of a botnet, and on the knowledge of how exploit it for illicit spamming activities and other illicit activities using them. For these reasons, knowledge of using spamming tools is of benefit to his business.

document_reference.excerpt: Student at the University of Akron

document_reference.name: Emails sent on behalf of individuals who sell counterfeit goods
document_reference.excerpt: He sent billions of spam emails on behalf of individuals who were selling counterfeit Rolexes, non-FDA approved herbal remedies, and counterfeit prescription medications.

document_reference.name: Email campaign for a pump and dump scheme
document_reference.excerpt: Bragg admitted today that he participated in a mass e-mail campaign in support of an illegal, get-rich-quick stock manipulation scam. The conspirators may have updated the fraud with technology, but strip away the army of computers and this is a classic pump and dump scheme.

document_reference.name: Sending unsolicited commercial email is illegal
document_reference.excerpt: The indictment alleges that the volume of electronic mail messages transmitted in furtherance of the offense exceeded 250,000 during a one-year period. The maximum possible penalty for this offense is imprisonment for not more than three years, a fine of not more than $250,000, and up to one year of supervised release. A restitution order also may be issued.

document_reference.name: Use of university network to control a botnet
document_reference.excerpt: He used the University's computer network to access IRC channels on the Internet to control other computers and computer networks via computers intentionally infected and taken over, known as "BotNet" zombies.

document_reference.name: Use of compromised computers to spread malicious codes
document_reference.excerpt: Frost admitted using the compromised computers to spread malicious computer codes, commands and information to even more computers.

document_reference.name: Set up a website to sell synthetic cannabis
document_reference.excerpt: Prosecutors asked the court for a tough sentence after Frost lied to his probation officer about an online business he'd set up following his arrest. In a letter to the court, Frost said he set up the Discountjwh.com website earlier this year after quitting his job as a Stanley Steemer carpet cleaning technician. JWH is a form of synthetic cannabis that is legal for sale in some U.S. states, including Ohio.

document_reference.name: Gain access and control over vulnerable systems
document_reference.excerpt: gaining unauthorized access to and control over such computers, and fraudulently obtaining user names and passwords for users on such systems.

document_reference.name: Use of hijacked online brokerage accounts
document_reference.excerpt: without the account holders' knowledge, and using the victims' own accounts and funds, the Defendants placed scores of unauthorized buy orders at above-market prices.

document_reference.name: Scan internet searching for vulnerable networks
document_reference.excerpt: Scanning the Internet searching for computer networks which were vulnerable to attack or unauthorized intrusion.

document_reference.name: Harvest data from computer networks
document_reference.excerpt: all for the purpose of harvesting and obtaining information and data from the compromised computer networks, including user names, passwords, credit card numbers, and cvv security codes

document_reference.name: Exploit network
document_reference.excerpt: According to court documents, Frost admitted that between August 2006, and March 2007, while enrolled as a student at the University of Akron, he used the University's computer network to access IRC channels on the Internet to control other computers and computer networks via computers intentionally infected and taken over.

document_reference.name: Hired to send emails promoting counterfeit goods
document_reference.excerpt: He sent billions of spam emails on behalf of individuals who were selling counterfeit Rolexes, non-FDA approved herbal remedies, and counterfeit prescription medications. In return, Mr. Nikolaenko was paid hundreds of thousands of dollars.

document_reference.name: Hired to illegally promote stocks

document_reference.name: Knock offline websites belonging to conservative pundits

document_reference.name: Send messages by use of a botnet
